objinfo.numberleaves: 1Blake's letter is on one side (object 1) of a single leaf, which was folded to form a packet. The letter appears on what would have been the interior of the folded packet (object 1). On the reverse side of object 1 five lines of unclear text are inscribed in pencil in an unknown hand: "Mr. H[eaphy]. was brought up / as an Engraver but / [became & An artist?] / in water color / He died 1835".

provenance.name: Harry Ransom Center, The University of Texas at Austin
provenance.note: Sold at Sotheby's, 3-4 June 1907, lot 385 (£10.15s. to B. F. Stevens); in the collection of Goodspeed's in Boston by 1925; later in the collection of George C. Smith, Jr.; sold after Smith’s death at the Parke-Bernet Galleries, New York, 2 November 1938, lot 7 ($45 to Sessler); later in the collection of Moncure Biddle; sold by Biddle at the Parke-Bernet Galleries, 29 April 1952, lot 117 ($100 to Schwartz); acquired by Dr. E. Hanley of Bradford, Pennsylvania; sold by Dr. Hanley in 1965 to the University of Texas.

repository.institution: Harry Ransom Center, The University of Texas at Austin

desc.objtitle: Letter to [John Linnell?], 11 October 1819, supplemental view, Object 1, reverse side

objnote.p: Blake's letter is on one side (object 1) of a single leaf, which was folded to form a packet. The letter appears on what would have been the interior of the folded packet (object 1). On the reverse side of object 1 five lines of unclear text are inscribed in pencil in an unknown hand: "Mr. H[eaphy]. was brought up / as an Engraver but / [became & An artist?] / in water color / He died 1835".
